Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl

Class ALEdge

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.cnrs.iees.graph.ElementAdapter
      • fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl.ALEdge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connected<Edge>, Edge, Element, Specialized, Identity, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ALDataEdge, ALReadOnlyDataEdge
    public class ALEdge
extends ElementAdapter
implements Edge

    The Edge implementation to use with ALGraph. AL stands for "Adjacency List". This class of edge records the Nodes at its two tips as startNode() and endNode(), so it is directed by default.

    The constructor is hidden (protected): only ALGraphFactory can instantiate ALEdges. ALNode also provides methods to instantiate ALEdges as a by-product of connecting to another node (internally calling ALGraphFactory, of course).

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 10 mai 2019

      • traversal

        public java.util.Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(int distance)
        Description copied from interface: Connected
        As traversal(), but stopping after distance recursion steps. For example, node.traversal(1) will return only node, while node.traversal(2) will return all the nodes connected with only 1 edge to this one.
        Specified by:
        traversal in interface Connected<Edge>
        Parameters:
        distance - the number of recursion steps to search
        Returns:
        the connected component (=sub-graph) containing this instance

      • replace

        public final void replace​(Edge element)
        Description copied from interface: Connected
